intro: Phyllobolus abbreviatus, commonly known as the shortleaf burrweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases seeds when disturbed. Phyllobolus abbreviatus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
